insertData

public static void insertData(HandlerProxy proxy,
                              int rowCount,
                              long keyColumnValue,
                              UUID uuid)
Inserts the number of specified rows with each row containing a column, TestConstants.COLUMN1, with the value provided and another column, TestConstants.COLUMN2, with an arbitrary value

Parameters:
proxy - The proxy to use for invoking a scan, not null
rowCount - The valid number of rows expected to be returned from the scan
keyColumnValue - The value stored in the first column, which is intended to be indexed
uuid - The unique identifier to associate with each row inserted, not null

insertNullData

                                  int rows)
Inserts the number of specified rows with each row containing the column, TestConstants.COLUMN2, with an arbitrary value and random UUID.

Parameters:
proxy -
rows -
See Also:
insertNullData(HandlerProxy, int, String)

insertNullData

public static void insertNullData(HandlerProxy proxy,
                                  int rowCount,
                                  String columnName)
Inserts the number of specified rows with each row containing the provided column name with an arbitrary value and random UUID. The rows created do not use columns used for indexing such as TestConstants.COLUMN1 and TestConstants.COLUMN2

Parameters:
proxy - The proxy to use for invoking a scan, not null
rowCount - The valid number of rows expected to be returned from the scan
columnName - The column name to associated with the inserted row, not null or empty

createKey

public static QueryKey createKey(int keyValue,
                                 QueryType queryType)
Creates an index on TestConstants.COLUMN1 for the provided value with the index name of TestConstants.INDEX1

Parameters:
keyValue - The value stored in the indexed column
queryType - The query type that this index will be used for
Returns:
The constructed index with the provided details

createRow

public static Row createRow(int columnValue)

assertRowCount

public static void assertRowCount(HandlerProxy proxy,
                                  TableSchema schema,
                                  long expectedRowCount)
Check that the table open on the proxy has the expected number of data rows and index rows on each index (checks both ascending and descending directions). Note: this could be very slow for big tables.

Parameters:
proxy - HandlerProxy with table already open
schema - TableSchema of open table
expectedRowCount - Expected number of rows

startProxyActionConcurrently

public static void startProxyActionConcurrently(int concurrency,
                                                ITUtils.ProxyRunnable setup,
                                                ITUtils.ProxyRunnable action,
                                                ITUtils.ProxyRunnable cleanup,
                                                HandlerProxyFactory factory)
                                         throws InterruptedException
Start concurrency number of actions concurrently and at the same time. This method ensures that the actions are started at the same time, and they are not being blocked in a thread pool. Obviously, this uses concurrency number of threads simultaneously so use caution as thread starvation deadlock can occur with high concurrency levels.

Parameters:
concurrency - Number of handler proxies to run the action against, concurrently
setup - Action to be run on each proxy before starting concurrent actions
action - Action to be run concurrently and in sync with other proxies
cleanup - Action to be run to cleanup proxy
factory - HandlerProxyFactory to supply proxies to be run concurrently
Throws:
InterruptedException
